text: I start tasks but get distracted before finishing them.
I forget appointments, deadlines, or scheduled activities.
I lose track of details or make mistakes due to inattention.
I overlook instructions or skip steps unintentionally.
I struggle to stay focused when reading or listening.
I misplace everyday items like keys, phone, or documents.
I get sidetracked during conversations or meetings.
I struggle to manage time or estimate how long things will take.
I avoid or delay tasks that require sustained mental effort.
I frequently shift from one activity to another without completing either.
I speak or act without considering the consequences.
I find it hard to resist interrupting others.
I blurt out thoughts in situations where it’s inappropriate.
I react emotionally without thinking things through.
I make impulsive purchases or decisions I later regret.
I struggle to delay gratification or wait my turn.
I finish other people’s sentences or cut them off.
I take risks without fully evaluating them.
I get frustrated easily and over small things.
I often feel “on edge” and react quickly.
I feel restless even when I’m sitting still.
I pace, tap, or fidget frequently.
I get up often during situations that require staying seated.
I feel like I need to be constantly doing something.
I talk excessively or dominate discussions.
I find it hard to unwind or relax quietly.
I seek constant stimulation or movement.
I shift positions frequently when trying to sit still.
I do multiple things at once but struggle to complete them.
I often feel a buildup of energy or tension without a clear cause.
